summary: Users should be able to require the payload codec from the data converter file in the Ruby SDK. Currently, the payload codec is not exported when requiring 'temporalio/converters', making it unavailable despite being part of the data converter functionality.
userImpact: Users cannot access the payload codec through the standard converters require path, requiring them to know about alternative import methods.
rootCause: The payload codec is not exported from the data converter file which is required from the top-level converters file.
proposedFix: Export the payload codec from the data converter file so it is available when requiring 'temporalio/converters'.
keyQuote: Users should be able to `require 'temporalio/converters'` and have payload codec, but it is not required from the data converter file
